recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk, or more to taste
1 teaspoon non-dairy creamer (such as Coffee-Mate®), or more to taste
1 teaspoon hot cocoa mix (such as Godiva®), or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour some boiling water in a glass. Let sit to warm the glass, about 1 minute. Pour out water.
Pour condensed milk into the warmed glass. Top with coffee. Stir in creamer and hot cocoa mix.
Place 1/4 cup coffee grounds into each jar, then top with water. Screw on the lids until just barely tightened; do not overtighten.

Fill a large pot with enough water to cover the jars completely and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set temperature to 150 degrees F (65 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions.
Submerge mason jars into the water bath and set timer for 2 hours.

Remove jars to a cooling rack and let cool until easily handled. Strain the mixture through a coffee filter to stop the steeping process. Pour over ice and serve, or return to rinsed-out jars and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
Blend ice, almond milk, espresso, and honey in a blender until smooth.
Blend coffee, coconut oil, and butter together in a blender until oil and butter are melted and coffee is frothy.
Pour coffee into an ice cube tray. Freeze until solid, 3 to 4 hours.
Place frozen coffee cubes in a blender. Add milk, chocolate syrup, and sugar; blend until smooth.
Pour coffee mixture into 2 glasses and top with whipped cream.
Fill a glass with ice cubes. Pour in tonic water, then cold brew coffee.

Combine condensed milk, nonfat milk, almond extract, and cinnamon in a glass Mason jar; cover and shake well. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Shake before using, as condensed milk will settle to the bottom.
Stir vanilla extract and sugar into boiling water until sugar has dissolved. Refrigerate until cool, about 30 minutes.
Chill four glasses, if desired.
Divide ice and chilled coffee evenly between four glasses. Stir in sugar mixture and cream to taste.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 (1 gram) packets granular sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®)
recipe_directions_formatted: Mix milk, coffee, and sweetener together in a glass until sweetener is dissolved.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ¼ cup white chocolate chips, chopped
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine milk and cream in a saucepan and whisk over high heat until hot and frothy. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and sugar. Whisk together hot espresso and white chocolate chips in a mug until smooth. If you are making two, pour half into another mug. Top with frothy hot milk and stir to blend in flavoring.
Mix water and sugar together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring regularly, until sugar is completely dissolved completely, about 5 minutes.

Stir 6 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla, and pumpkin pie spice into the sugar syrup; bring to a simmer. Cook until mixture is well spiced, 8 to 10 minutes.
Strain mixture through a sheet of cheesecloth into a bowl. Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat.
Stir condensed milk and remaining 2 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling into the spiced syrup. Cook, stirring regularly, until pumpkin dissolves into the liquid, about 5 minutes.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 packet granulated sugar substitute, or to taste
½ teaspoon cocoa powder, for garnish
recipe_directions_formatted: In a small mug or coffee cup, mix cocoa and granulated sugar substitute together. Add a few tablespoons of coffee and stir until cocoa is completely dissolved. Pour in remaining coffee.
Foam milk. Spoon a generous amount over hot mocha. Garnish with a pinch of cocoa powder, if desired.

Place the espresso, caramel sauce, and sugar into a blender pitcher. Blend on high until the caramel and sugar dissolve into the espresso. Pour in the milk and add the ice; continue blending until smooth and frothy. Top with whipped cream to serve.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 16 ounces Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - House Blend
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine rice, water, and almonds in a blender. Blend the mixture until well combined, about 2 minutes. The mixture will be coarse.
Strain mixture through a fine sieve or cheesecloth into a pitcher; discard solids. Stir in cold brew concentrate and blue agave.
Serve over ice. Garnish with cinnamon sticks.
Combine milk, caramel sauce, and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Froth mixture using a stick blender.
Pour hot milk mixture into a mug, holding back the foam with the back of a spoon. Add coffee and pour foam on top.
In a small bowl, mix together the molasses, brown sugar, baking soda, ginger and cinnamon until well blended. Cover and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes.

Add about a 1/4 cup of coffee to each cup, then stir in about a tablespoon of the spice mixture until dissolved. Fill cup to within an inch of the top with coffee. Stir in half and half to taste, then garnish with whipped cream and a light dusting of cloves.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 packet granular no-calorie sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®)
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour coffee into an ice cube tray; freeze until coffee ice cubes form, 1 to 2 hours.
Combine coffee ice cubes, soy milk, chocolate syrup, peanut butter, vanilla extract, and no-calorie sweetener in a blender. Cover and blend until frothy.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 4 cups ice cubes, or as needed
1 cup white sugar, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Place 2 cups of ice cubes into a 2-quart pitcher; slowly pour coffee over ice and stir until ice is melted. Stir sugar into coffee and mix thoroughly until sugar is completely dissolved. Add milk, stirring just until combined. Stir in remaining 2 cups ice, adding more as needed; refrigerate until well chilled, about 30 minutes.
Stir before serving. Pour over ice in tall glasses or into recycled serving-size glass bottles or insulated tumblers.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 3 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Stir espresso and sweetened condensed milk together in a bowl. Add milk and stir; pour into a blender. Add ice and chocolate syrup to the espresso mixture. Blend until smooth.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½ pound coarsely ground coffee beans
recipe_directions_formatted: Put coffee grounds in a large container. Slowly pour water over grounds.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and steep at room temperature for 18 to 24 hours.

Line a strainer with several layers of cheesecloth and place atop a pitcher; strain coffee through the cheesecloth into the pitcher. Discard the grounds. To get a clearer brew, strain coffee again through coffee filters. Store in refrigerator.
Heat milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan until frothy, close to simmering. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in cookie butter and cinnamon, then mix in coffee.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 teaspoon cocoa powder, or more to taste
½ teaspoon vanilla extract, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend milk, ice cubes, sugar, instant coffee granules, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth.
Lightly coat the inside of a glass with chocolate syrup. Pour the coffee mixture into the glass. Top with whipped cream to serve.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 tablespoons sugar-free chocolate syrup, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Heat 1/4 cup coffee in microwave in a mug until warmed, about 30 seconds. Stir cocoa mix into the coffee until dissolved.
Fill a large glass with ice cubes. Pour 1 cup cold coffee and almond milk over the ice cubes; stir the cocoa mixture and chocolate syrup into the coffee and almond milk.
Place coffee and cardamom in the filter of your coffee machine. Place enough water to make 2 cups of coffee in the machine. Turn on the coffee machine.
Pour brewed coffee into 2 coffee cups, and stir 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk into each cup. Serve.
Combine milk, banana, and simple syrup in a blender; blend until very smooth, about 1 minute.
Fill two 16-ounce glasses with ice cubes. Divide coffee between the glasses. Pour banana milk on top, dividing it evenly between the glasses.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ¼ cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
1 teaspoon stevia powder, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine coffee, ice cubes, lemon juice, and stevia in a glass. Stir. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
Combine half-and-half, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla extract together in a container with a lid; cover container and shake vigorously until creamer is smooth.
Pour the coffee into a mug. Stir in the coffee liqueur and tequila. Garnish with whipped topping, cinnamon, and cocoa powder.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 tablespoons any flavor of flavored syrup
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the flavored syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over the top.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste
1 tablespoon whipped cream topping, or to taste (Optional)
recipe_directions_formatted: Mix half-and-half, sugar, and pumpkin pie spice together in a coffee mug. Pour coffee into mug; stir to blend.
Heat in microwave until hot, about 15 seconds. Top with whipped cream.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 cup boiling water, or as needed
recipe_directions_formatted: Place butter, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and vanilla extract in the bottom of an Irish coffee glass. Pour in rum and hot water. Stir.

Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the chocolate syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Top with whipped cream.

Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the white chocolate syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Top with whipped cream and serve.

Whisk 4 ounces cream, maple syrup, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, and vanilla extract together in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat pumpkin mixture in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between intervals, until heated through and completely blended, 1 to 3 minutes.
Pour sweetened condensed milk, remaining 10 ounces cream, and pumpkin mixture into a container, cover the container with a lid, and shake until completely mixed. Store in the refrigerator.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½ cup Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - Vanilla
2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste
1 tablespoon whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®)
2 teaspoons caramel ice cream topping, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Place cold brew concentrate, milk, 2 tablespoons caramel ice cream syrup, and sugar in blender; blend until mixed, 5 to 10 seconds. Add ice cubes and blend well, about 5 seconds. Pour into a glass.
Serve topped with whipped topping and a drizzle of caramel syrup.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine the instant coffee, milk, vanilla extract, sugar, ice, and chocolate syrup in a blender; blend until smooth.

recipe_name: 40 Coffee Shop Drinks and Treats You Can Make at Home

recipe_directions_formatted: Pour sugar into a shallow dish. Wet the rim of a wine glass or Irish coffee mug and dip in sugar to coat. Add rum and triple sec. Use a long match or lighter to carefully ignite the mixture. Turn glass slowly until sugar begins to caramelize. Pour in coffee liqueur to put out the flame. Top with hot coffee.
Whisk boiling water, instant coffee, and sugar together until coffee is dissolved. Continue to whisk until mixture becomes thick and forms a peak, 2 to 3 minutes.
Pour milk into a glass. Pour the frothy coffee on top of the milk.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour hot brewed coffee into a glass mug. Stir in Irish cream liqueur.
Bring sugar and water to a boil in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in instant coffee, and allow to cool, 30 to 45 minutes.
When cool, stir in vodka and vanilla extract. Pour into clean bottles. Close the bottles tightly and store in a cool dark place.

You will need 8 mugs or glass coffee cups. Pour 1 ounce of coffee liqueur into each mug, then add one ounce of brandy and 1/2 ounce of creme de cacao to each serving. Fill each mug with hot coffee, garnish with a dollop of whipped cream, and top with chocolate sprinkles; serve.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 teaspoons half-and-half cream, or to taste
1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Mix the ground coffee, allspice, and cinnamon in a small bowl, and place into the filter of a drip coffee maker. Pour 4 cups of water into the coffee maker, and turn on the machine. When coffee has finished dripping, pour into 2 cups. Stir in cream and sugar to taste.
Pour milk and eggnog into a steaming pitcher and heat to between 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand.
Brew a shot of espresso; pour into a mug. Pour steamed milk and eggnog into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over the top. Sprinkle nutmeg on top of foam.
Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand of an espresso machine.
Pour espresso over vanilla syrup in a large coffee mug. Pour steamed milk over espresso, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over top.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 cups filtered water, at room temperature
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour ground coffee into a French press container and add water. Place plunger lid on top and press the plunger down 1 to 2 inches to make sure all coffee grounds are fully submerged; do not press all the way down. Let coffee steep at room temperature for 16 to 18 hours.
Strain coffee through a coffee filter in a small strainer. Transfer to an airtight bottle or jar and keep in the refrigerator for up to a week.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®)
recipe_directions_formatted: Stir together coffee liqueur and tequila in a mug. Pour in hot coffee and top with whipped cream.

Combine sweetened condensed milk, skim milk, and vanilla in an airtight container; shake well to blend. Label the container with the expiration date of the milk used.

recipe_directions_formatted: Pour vanilla syrup into a drinking glass.

recipe_name: How to Make a Cafe Latte
recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 ⅓ cups hot freshly brewed dark roast espresso coffee
recipe_directions_formatted: Heat milk in a saucepan set over medium-low heat. Whisk briskly with a wire whisk to create foam.
Brew espresso and pour into four cups. Pour in milk, holding back the foam with a spoon. Spoon foam over the top.

recipe_name: Meet Manhattan Special: The Nostalgic Coffee Soda With a Cult Following

recipe_directions_formatted: Combine powdered sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and chili powder in the bottom of a mug.
Pour hot coffee on top and stir until dissolved. Pour in half-and-half creamer and stir.
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon, if desired.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 tablespoons Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine ice, coffee, Almond Breeze Original Almondmilk, Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer, chocolate syrup and chocolate chips in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Serve in glasses.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 cup strongly brewed black coffee, cooled
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend ice, coffee, milk, caramel sauce, and sugar together in a blender on high speed until smooth.
Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
Pour into two 16-ounce glasses.
DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS

Break 4 ounces of the white chocolate into small pieces and place in a medium microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH, stirring at 30-second intervals, until melted, about 1 1/2 minutes. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the melted chocolate into each of 6 (1 3/4-inch) silicone ball molds. Immediately flip mold over onto a cutting board or plate to allow chocolate to drip off and coat the mold. Let stand 2 minutes. Flip back over and use an offset spatula to scrape the tops of molds to clean them off, placing any dripped chocolate back into the bowl. Place silicone mold in freezer to set, about 5 minutes. Release chocolate "cups" from silicone molds; set aside. Repeat with another 4 ounces of chocolate.
While the molds chill, stir together beverage mix and pumpkin pie spice in a small bowl. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the mixture into 6 of the "cups."

Place the bowl of the leftover melted chocolate back in the microwave; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Spoon or pour into a small zip-top plastic bag or piping bag and snip off 1/16-inch of the corner. Pipe a thin chocolate line along the edge of the 6 filled white chocolate cups. Place remaining 6 cups on top, using the white chocolate line as glue. Smooth out with your finger, and gently place in silicone mold; freeze until set, about 5 minutes.
Remove the balls from freezer, and dip an offset spatula in very hot water; use it to smooth out edges of the chocolate ball seam. Set aside.

Break remaining 2 ounces of chocolate into pieces, and place in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Add food coloring, and stir to combine. Place in a separate ziplock bag and snip off 1/16-inch from a corner. Pipe in a zig-zag pattern on the balls. Freeze until set, about 5 minutes.
To serve, brew an 8- to 10-ounce cup of your favorite coffee. Place a bomb in the hot cup of coffee and stir to melt.
In a blender combine strawberries, banana, peaches, apples, and ice cream. Blend until smooth. Add ice, pour in milk and blend again until smooth. Serve immediately.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 2 tablespoons peanut butter, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend yogurt, banana, mango, and peanut butter together in a blender until smooth.
Place banana, blackberries, raspberries, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes into a blender. Blend until smooth.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ⅓ cup milk, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend bananas, yogurt, milk, ice cubes, and sugar together in a blender until smooth.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 ½ cups mangos - peeled, seeded, chopped, and chilled
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine mangos, yogurt, milk, cream, confectioners' sugar, and cardamom in a blender; blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
In a blender, combine banana, milk, vanilla, egg and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into a tall glass and top with a pinch of cinnamon.

Pour cream and half-and-half into an electric blender and blend on low speed until it begins to thicken. Add sugar and vanilla extract and mix for about 30 seconds. Add blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, and blackberries. Blend until smooth, adding milk if necessary to make blending easier.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1  banana, cut into pieces and frozen
recipe_directions_formatted: Place the nectarines, frozen banana chunks, orange, vanilla yogurt, orange juice, and honey into a blender, and blend until smooth.
Blend the milk, yogurt, vanilla extract, mango, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth and creamy.
Place 1 teaspoon chamoy on a plate. Place 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning on another plate. Dip rim of glass first in chamoy, then in chili-lime seasoning. Set aside.
Combine frozen mango, water, and lime juice in a blender; blend until smooth.
Place 1/2 tablespoon chamoy in the bottom of the glass. Add 1/2 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning and 1/2 of the blended mangoes. Repeat layers and top with diced fresh mango.
Pour pineapple juice into a blender and add banana, strawberries, and blueberries. Cover and blend until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into 2 glasses.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste
1 pinch ground cinnamon, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend blueberries, yogurt, orange juice, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a blender on low speed for 30 seconds; increase speed to high and blend until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add ice and blend on high until smooth, about 1 minute more.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½  mango, chopped, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend mango, yogurt, almond milk, ice, protein powder, and honey together in a blender until smooth.
Blend milk, yogurt, banana, peanut butter, spinach, and ice cubes until smooth.
Process the watermelon and milk together in a blender until smooth. Add the sugar and blend another 10 seconds to incorporate. Serve immediately.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½ cup ice, or as needed
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend almond milk, banana, ice, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and cinnamon together in a blender until smooth.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ¼ cup white sugar, or to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend yogurt, peaches, bananas, orange juice, sugar, and ice in a blender on high until the ice is crushed and the smoothie is to your desired consistency.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½  frozen banana, peeled and cut into chunks
recipe_directions_formatted: Place soy milk, strawberries, banana, and flaxseed meal into a blender; blend until smooth.
Blend strawberries, yogurt, milk, peanut butter, and brown sugar together in a blender for 2 minutes; let rest for 10 seconds. Blend until smooth, another 2 minutes.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 medium Gala apple, peeled, cored and chopped
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine apple, frozen banana, orange juice, and milk in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into glasses to serve.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ¼  cantaloupe - peeled, seeded and cubed
¼  honeydew melon - peeled, seeded and cubed
recipe_directions_formatted: In a blender, combine cantaloupe, honeydew, lime juice and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.
Place the banana, strawberries, blueberries, cherries, and ice cubes into a blender. Pour in the orange juice, vanilla yogurt, and honey. Puree until smooth.

recipe_name: Cocoa, Banana, and Peanut Butter Smoothie
recipe_ingredients_formatted: ½  chopped frozen banana, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Blend together milk, frozen banana, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey in a blender until smooth.
Blend strawberries, raspberries, milk, yogurt, honey, and vanilla together in a blender until smooth.
Place yogurt, peanut butter, banana, strawberries, and ice cubes into a blender. Puree until smooth.

recipe_name: Blueberry, Banana, and Peanut Butter Smoothie
recipe_directions_formatted: Put flaxseed meal into a blender to grind and further break down.
Place banana, milk, blueberries, yogurt, peanut butter, and honey into the blender. Cover and purée until smooth.
Pour into glasses to serve.
Layer milk, protein powder, ice, strawberries, banana, and peanut butter in a blender in this order; blend until creamy and smooth.
Combine milk, strawberries, honey, and vanilla in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 1 cup vanilla yogurt (such as Dannon® Light and Fit®)
4  ice cubes, crushed, or as needed
recipe_directions_formatted: Process yogurt, orange juice, cantaloupe, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds.
Combine milk, yogurt, sugar, and salt in a blender. Add oranges and banana and blend for about 1 minute. Add ice and blend until smooth.

recipe_name: 19 Easy Smoothie Recipes With 3 Ingredients or Less

recipe_ingredients_formatted: ¾ cup pineapple and orange juice blend
recipe_directions_formatted: Place juice blend, frozen yogurt, banana, strawberries, and kiwi into a blender. Blend until smooth and pour into 2 glasses.
Layer protein powder, flax meal, cocoa powder, and brown sugar in a blender. Add almond milk, frozen berries, banana, and peanut butter. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute.
Blend banana, avocado, spinach, milk, ice cubes, honey, and vanilla together in a blender until smooth.

recipe_directions_formatted: Blend strawberries, orange juice, banana, and ice in a blender until smooth and frothy.
Combine spinach, almond milk, kale, peanut butter, and chia seeds in a blender; blend until smooth. Add banana and blend until smooth.

recipe_directions_formatted: Add banana, mango, strawberries, juice, and coconut water to a blender. Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape sides as needed. Pour into a glass; garnish with fresh strawberry.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 9 ounces frozen mixed fruit (strawberries, peaches, pineapple, and mango)
recipe_directions_formatted: Pour coconut water into a Vitamix blender. Add frozen fruit. Slowly turn the blender to Variable 10, then to High 10. Blend for 45 seconds.
Pour smoothie into glass; garnish with strawberry and blackberry if desired.

recipe_directions_formatted: Place almond milk, apple, strawberries, banana, and yogurt in a blender, being sure the milk goes in first. Process until smooth, occasionally scraping down the sides of the blender with a rubber spatula, if necessary.
Pour into serving glasses and serve immediately.

recipe_ingredients_formatted: 6  frozen strawberries, or more to taste
1 tablespoon blue agave nectar, or more to taste
recipe_directions_formatted: Combine strawberries, milk, peanut butter, blue agave, and flax seeds in a blender and blend until well combined.
Place juice and banana in blender. Blend on high until smooth and frothy. about 30 seconds. Serve immediately.
